channel.title: Storyline
channel.description:
Why, hello there. It's come across my mind that there are no significant servers anymore -- They all require no thought, or special ideas (as should be).
I figured a storyline may be a great way to accomplish this. I'll be writing the storyline (and implementing it) in my spare time. I already have 297 lines (13520 chars) written about a storyline, in outline format: [code] [1] [A] [1] [2] [B] [1] [2] [C] [1] [2] [2] ... [/code] Etc.
I don't plan to make this a *massive* development, but I will be using hyperion (or RuneSource).
A small snippet of the storyline (+ format): [code=Outline][1] Tut-Island //Completion: 2% [A] Travel through different areas [1] Completed: N/A
[2] Lumbridge //Completion: 8% [A] Journey of the warrior [1] Kill enemies [A] Cows, chickens. [1] Get lumbridge tanner to tan hides [A] Craft hides(Hides>Lowest level[coifs, I think?]) [2] Fletch shafts/arrows [A] Combat(Chickens[Feathers]) [B] Woodcutting(Logs) [C] Fletching(Shafts+Feathers) [D] Mining(Copper/Tin ore) [E] Smithing(Bronze arrowheads) [F] Fletching(Heads) [2] Survive in wilderness [A] Fishing [B] Woodcutting [C] Firemaking [D] Cooking[/code] Explanation: The first (no tabs) numeral is the location. Afterward, it flows down into different sections of the area, such as quests and missions containing quests.
There will be two sides to this story, as I believe there should; Saradomin/Zamorak.
I'm not actually turning this into a development *team*, but if you support this and want to join, I'd gladly accept anyone who meets the following requirements: [code] GOOD GRAMMAR. <*ABSOLUTE MUST*< Small amounts of free-time. Common sense. Ability to accept (and give) criticism. Strictly dislikes any low-quality bases, or misplaced revisions (317 loading 400+ is disallowed). [/code] My MSN is fifaace@gmail.com. Anyway, please post feedback.
P.S. This is a rather large storyline. I have less than 7% of the story completed, and it took two hours to write (I'm not a slow typer, and ideas flow through me easily).
Edit: Also, if you take part in writing the storyline, you will be given credits. I may also need people to help me implement the storyline into the server (server base suggestions are also available).

item.title: Storyline
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[code][1] Tut-Island //Completion: 2%

[2] Lumbridge //Completion: 8%

[3] Al-Kharid //Completion: 5%

[4] Varrock //Completion: 15%

[5] Edgeville //Completion: 2%

[6] Wilderness //Completion: 20%

[7] Falador //Completion: 12%

[8] Seers Village //Completion: 3%

[9] Camelot //Completion: 14%

[10] Ardougne //Completion: 14%

[11] Castle Wars; “The Battlegrounds.” //Completion: 5%[/code]
Basic outline so far (towns/areas). Btw, “Completion: x%” means how much of the storyline it will be. Meaning, after you finish Tut. Island and Lumbridge, you will have 10% story completion.

Read full topic

Anyway, thanks.
[/quote]

More feedback please, x.x

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Why, hello there.
It’s come across my mind that there are no significant servers anymore – They all require no thought, or special ideas (as should be).

I figured a storyline may be a great way to accomplish this.
I’ll be writing the storyline (and implementing it) in my spare time. I already have 297 lines (13520 chars) written about a storyline, in outline format:

[1]

    [2]
  [C]
    [1]
    [2]
[2]
...

Etc.

I don’t plan to make this a massive development, but I will be using hyperion (or RuneSource).

A small snippet of the storyline (+ format):

[code=Outline][1] Tut-Island //Completion: 2%
[A] Travel through different areas
[1] Completed: N/A

Explanation:
The first (no tabs) numeral is the location.
Afterward, it flows down into different sections of the area, such as quests and missions containing quests.

There will be two sides to this story, as I believe there should; Saradomin/Zamorak.

I’m not actually turning this into a development team, but if you support this and want to join, I’d gladly accept anyone who meets the following requirements:

GOOD GRAMMAR. <*ABSOLUTE MUST*<
Small amounts of free-time.

Ability to accept (and give) criticism.
Strictly dislikes any low-quality bases, or misplaced revisions (317 loading 400+ is disallowed).

My MSN is fifaace@gmail.com.
Anyway, please post feedback.

P.S. This is a rather large storyline. I have less than 7% of the story completed, and it took two hours to write (I’m not a slow typer, and ideas flow through me easily).

Edit: Also, if you take part in writing the storyline, you will be given credits. I may also need people to help me implement the storyline into the server (server base suggestions are also available).
